snippet: The Constitutional Court on Thursday ruled in favor of a former army chief who was appealing the legality of his initial detention in 2012 in a case that resulted in his conviction and life sentence last year for plotting a coup against the...
abstract: Turkey's Constitutional Court rules in favor of Gen Ilker Basbug, former army chief appealing legality of his 2012 detention; case had resulted in his conviction and life sentence in 2013 for plotting coup against the government; ruling paves way for his possible release from Istanbul prison.
lead_paragraph: The Constitutional Court on Thursday ruled in favor of a former army chief who was appealing the legality of his initial detention in 2012 in a case that resulted in his conviction and life sentence last year for plotting a coup against the government, according to a written statement posted on the court’s website.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
